page.title: 01General Information
page.content: { Somerton}is a thriving, rural town situated in the middle of Somerset. The population is less than 4500 and has doubled since 1951 as many new private and council estates have been built. Originally most workers were employed in agriculture but Yeovilton Air Base, Westland Helicopters, Clarks Shoes and a light industrial estate on the edge of Somerton have brought in many families from all over Britain. The surrounding countryside is largely unspoiled, being mainly dairy farming and cereal growing.In the south-eastern corner is the village of {Kingsdon},which like Somerton is a dormitory town for Yeovilton Air Base. Both towns are mainly built of local limestone and hamstone.Because of its position and attractive buildings Somerton is a popular centre for tourists visiting the West Country.
